conversation.text: I highly recommend "The Alamo" (2004). It's a gripping historical drama based on the Battle of San Antonio, Texas on March 6, 1836, between the Mexican army commanded by General Santa Anna and an army of about 700 men led by Sam Houston, who were mainly volunteers from among Texas' white population. The battle took place in a valley just east of San Antonio, Texas. After several days of indecisive fighting, which included numerous cavalry charges, both sides agreed to sign the Treaty of Gadsden on May 29, 1836, in the same valley where the Battle of San Antonio had taken place earlier that month.
